name: Mixed Bag 20 Trivia Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Difficult [D] | 10 Questions

questions.text: Alice Marble is a name associated with which sport?
questions.explanation:
Tennis.

	She was a four time winner of the singles title at the U.S. Nationals which became the U.S. Open in 1968. She won in 1936, 1938, 1939 and 1940.

questions.text: Which of the following is not one of the 'foursome' on TV's 'Facts Of Life'?
questions.explanation:
Shelly.

	Nalalie is the fourth one.

questions.text: How many years did Penelope Odysseus' wife wait for his return?
questions.explanation:
20 years.

	He was gone for more than 20 years during and after the Trojan War. Most versions said she remained faithful for all that time.

questions.text: What was the first name of 'My Little Margie's' dad?
questions.explanation:
Vern.

	His full name was Vernon Albright. The show ran from June 1952 until August 1955.

questions.text: Mohammad Zia Ul-Haq was the president of which country from 1978 till 1988?
questions.explanation:
Pakistan.

	In 1988 he died in a plane crash.

questions.text: (True or False) Chicken George was a character on TV's miniseries 'Roots'?
questions.explanation:
True & T.

	The complete title 'Roots: The Saga Of An American Family'. It was written by Alex Haley and considered by many as his best work.

questions.text: What would you find in the Chinese dish Moo Goo Gai Pan?
questions.explanation:
Chicken.

	This dish consists of chicken breasts, garlic, mushrooms, Chinese white cabbage, scallions and various spices.

questions.text: Who was voted CBS's 1985 'Sportscaster of the Year'?
questions.explanation:
John Madden.

	He has won at least 13 Emmy Awards since 1982. As coach of the Raiders he won 112 games and the 1976 Super Bowl.

questions.text: In the nursery rhyme 'The Farmer In The Dell', what does the nurse take?
questions.explanation:
Cow.

	The cow takes the dog, the dog takes the cat and etc.

questions.text: Benito Mussolini's father had what for an occupation?
questions.explanation:
Blacksmith.

	The son of a socialist blacksmith Mussolini became a school teacher and a socialist journalist before turning to Fascism.
